result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
-Commit no acts which rise to the level of probable cause in violation of the criminal laws of the state of Wisconsin, or of any other state, or of the United States of America.
-Comply with all conditions of bail or bond in this case.
-Defendant will keep Douglas County Clerk of Courts informed of his address and telephone number at all times, and stipulates that the sending of notice by regular mail to the address on file with the Clerk of Courts constitutes sufficient notice of any court hearings scheduled in this matter.  The non-appearance of the defendant may result in the issuance of an arrest warrant.
- Defendant has participated in an ADOA evaluation pre-plea, defendant will follow the assessor's recommendations as provided through this evaluation

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Evah Ngendo Kambo

records.addlTxt: 9:31 AM Defendant Evah Ngendo Kambo in court.  Attorney Fredric B. Anderson in court for Evah Ngendo Kambo.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. State recommends 12 months of deferred judgment. If completed, will move to dismiss. Attorney Anderson is in agreement. Defendant pleads no contest to charge. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. The Defendant understands all the rights she is waiving by her plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is deferred pursuant to the terms of the agreement.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

records.addlTxt:
9:46 AM Prosecuting attorney Chad C La Lor in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Evah Ngendo Kambo in court.  Attorney Fredric B. Anderson in court for Evah Ngendo Kambo. 
Att Anderson- Client will waive prelim
Court finds probable cause for bind over. Sets Arraignment date
Arraignment scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Evah Ngendo Kambo
Current: 1712 E 1St St, Duluth, MN 55812 United States  (Effective: 07-26-2022)
Prior: 1712 E 1St St, Duluth, MN 55811
No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

1:47 PM Prosecuting attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Evah Ngendo Kambo appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman appeared by video for Evah Ngendo Kambo. Defendant's address confirmed. Attorney/Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint, waives a formal reading, enters pleas of not guilty to the misdemeanor count(s), and requests a preliminary hearing. State asks for $250 cash bail. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. Defendant does not have any prior criminal convictions or FTAs but has lack of ties to Douglas County and notes severity of the charges alleged. Attorney Hoffman indicates that the defendant is employed in Duluth, has a child in Duluth, and has been a long time resident of St. Louis County. Defendant does not have anything to post, asks for high dollar signature bond. Attorney Hoffman makes statement regarding defendant's reaction to incarceration. Court addresses defendant's reaction. 

Court orders $1500 signature bond. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 10:45 am.
